dataList.dlg:
- Even the most effective soldier is useless in the hands of a doltish commander. Let us first observe the field of battle.
- Already done. The rest... is nothing that a sword cannot solve.

- My lord sees much in you. Give it your all.
- Heh. Do not pressure yourselves too much for perfection; our lord does not reprimand for insignificant causes.

- The situation is... indeed, quite unfavorable.
- Destroy all that stands in your way, and that should solve the problem.
- ... Are you serious?

- Mm. There lies a dark shadow before your path; a ray of light must first be found to progress forth.
- Must your metaphors be so obnoxious?
- ... Hm, perhaps it was too difficult for you to understand.
The enemy is swaying like a drunk fool under attack. Now would be the most opportune time to establish your dominance in battle.

- A hole in your defenses. Will you help them?
- It would be wise to exploit it, however...
- Our lord would have helped them.
- ... Fine. Help the wounded.
While you could not reverse the great flow... it was a good move nevertheless.

- ... That was certainly a mistake.
- Wrap them with stasis wraps.

- I... I was outplayed?
- Hongyuan alone is brimming with thousands of prodigies, and so are ways to outwit your tactics.
- You could afford to be a tad more diplomatic with your words.
- Says you.

- While you have the upper hand, overconfidence is sure to claim defeat from the jaws of victory.
- ... So what?
- I mean to say that they must stay alert for— Must I really spell it out for you?

- The fire still burns in their eyes.
- Are you truly committed to that course of action? Then it shan't be the heavens' will that wins this battle; it will be your own.

- Standing at the edge of a three-thousand meter fall.
- Yet, they stand still but a few footsteps short of the destination. They must walk the last stretch to leave no regrets.

- Their form is certainly powerful, yet we need only read their intent. A shallow strategy.
- Don't let your guard down, Zigong.

- Quite the mysterious strategy. But there must be a solution to break it apart.
- Without the solution, however, our allies are in a precarious position like an uncovered candle before a powerful gust.
- ... Correct.

- ... Perhaps we must first analyze the makeup of our troops.
- If that appears to be unfeasible, then you must first establish a strategy.
... Effective strike.

- Futile strike.
- Zilu. Why unnecessarily narrate them of what they can naturally tell for themselves?
- ... Ugh.
- Now, their strategy is revealed.
- Their actions contradict their own. This is a rare opportunity; let us leverage it to solidify the victorious winds for our war flags.

- Mistake, or an intended effect?
- If the purpose cannot be divulged, then we must first contemplate its use.

- They've employed tricks.
- Observe them closely. This may be a difficult move to outmaneuver.
- Hm. You have broken their wings.

- There is a meaningful gap of strength.
- Like a ball of snow rolling downhill, our allies' advantages will grow with exponentiality.

- Ngh. Have we walked right into our foes' ambush?
- Withdraw the men. I will—
- ... No, I can maneuver us out of this quandary.

- Be not so crestfallen. Certain things cannot be learned without facing them head-on.
- Did they have to face it head-on with their lives, however?
- This move claims both their cannons and chariots. Your maneuver exceeds my expectations.
- You've cut off their limbs. Now, go for the throat.

- Hmph, there are many who know how to wield a blade. What matters is if their blade follows a path.
- Simply compliment them if you enjoyed that display, Zilu. I cannot fathom why you would stay your praise for a commendable feat.

- I am Zigong, the strategist and the right-hand officer of my lord. Upon his orders, I will be taking command of your unit.
- ... I'm Zilu.
